page.title: 14St. Mary's Church, Watton
page.content: There is no Chancel arch in the church, but a Perpendicular Rood Screen extending from floor to ceiling divides the Chancel from the Nave. On either side of the screen, behind the pulpit and lectern, are large, framed, illustrated manuscripts of the Ten Commandments. The Communion Rail in the Chancel dates to the late 17th Century. Among the monuments in the church are thse to Sarah (1730) and Hugh Bethell. These date to the period when much of the surrounding area, including the Priory site, passed by marriage into the Bethell family. On the south wall of the Chancel is a priest door and a piscina - a basin for washing Communion vessels. Its drain is now blocked. The mounds in the field to the N.E. of the churchyard are the Priory remains.
